sections.content: Cross Country Ski Trail Conditions as of February 2, 2026 –

Bucks Run is groomed for skate and classic skiing. The connector trail between the ski center and Bucks Run is open. For your safety and the safety of our staff please adhere to Bucks Run hours.  Bucks Run is open Monday – Friday 12 pm – 7:45 pm and Saturday – Sunday 9 am – 7:45 pm, weather and conditions permitting.
– Trails are groomed. Open January 31st & February 1st.

Huron Meadows Metropark (Brighton).conditions: Bucks run in great condition for classic or skate from building and back.  Nice deep fast tracks and skate lane getting a little faster with some warmer temps.Skating was also great on the whole golf course and Cedar Trace even without it being groomed today.Thanks everyone at HM.

Stoney Creek Metropark (Shelby Township).conditions: Almost all trails have fresh park set tracks, but exposed areas were sometimes drifted over. There are some oak leave patches in the woods where deer have been digging for acorns. Despite these issues skiing was the best I've seen at Stoney in a long time,

nubsNob.xcTrails: Trails were power-tilled and tracked on Saturday morning. Conditions are extremely good.
nubsNob.nightSkiing: Tuesday thru Saturday from 5:30 to 9:00 p.m.
nubsNob.comments: It's a stellar Groundhog Day to ski at Nub's Nob. The grooming and snow quality are top-notch. The wind is light and the temperature is forecast to reach the mid 20's. Petoskey High School will host a BNC ski meet on Smokey and Valley today. These runs will only be open to the ski racers today. Pintail Peak Lodge is open with food service and an espresso bar. The soup of the day is unstuffed pepper. We are excited to welcome the Whooppee Ski Club back to Nub's Nob. The lifts will spin from 9:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. today. Make it a great day at Nub's Nob.
